This shocking footage shows the chaotic scenes at a boxing event last night when hundreds of fans began brawling with each other. 
The fans had gathered at Leeds United's Elland Road to watch a boxing match. 
But as one fight in the ring had finished, fans began brawling with each other in "disgusting" scenes at about 10.30pm. 
Revellers began by throwing chairs at each other and trading brutal blows at the Centenary Pavillion. 
Organisers screamed on the microphone to "calm the f**k down" with fights breaking out among different groups across the football club's conference centre. Read More British MMA fighter taunts rival with dance - then gets brutally knocked out with a kick to the head Footage shows hundreds brawling at a boxing event at Leeds United's Elland Road last night (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) As fighters waited in the ring for the result of a fight, fans began violently attacking each other (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) 
At one point, a woman in a blue dress punches a man in the face. 
He then turns around and hits her back, knocking her to the floor. She is later seen being carried away by her friends. 
As security men flood into the room, the fighting continues, with chairs thrown over crowds of people. A woman in a blue dress can be seen punching a man (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) But she is soon attacker herself by a man who punches her in the face (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) After hitting the ground, the woman is helped back onto her feet by her friends (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) 
A compere inside the ring desperately pleads with fans to stop fighting. 
He shouted: "We are here for boxing tonight and some of you have just ruined it. 
"It has been spoilt by you guys. We cannot continue like this... you are behaving like children. You are spoiling it for any other boxing event here in Leeds. It is such a shame." Men trading blows and threw chairs at each other (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) The room was left in chaotic scenes as tables and chairs were thrown (Photo: Danikai74/Youtube) 
Getting increasingly frustrated, he added: "If you don't want to be in here to watch the boxing f**k off."
